snippet: Though Mitt Romney argues that higher taxes deter small businesses from hiring, studies have cast doubt on the idea that small businesses are major job creators.
abstract: Debate over the roles of small businesses in job creation has been reignited by Pres Obama's proposal to let the Bush-era tax cuts expire for high-income earners, but studies have cast doubt on the idea that small businesses are major job creators, as Mitt Romney has argued.
lead_paragraph: Though Mitt Romney argues that higher taxes deter small businesses from hiring, studies have cast doubt on the idea that small businesses are major job creators.

headline.seo: Amid Tax Debate, a Closer Look at Small Businesses
headline.main: A Fuller Picture in the Small-Business Tug of War
headline.print_headline: A Fuller Picture in the Small-Business Tug of War
